MPAlternativesEvaluated: Four effort levels. Low, Moderate, High, and Very High effort equivalent to 80t, 110t, 140t, and 170t harvests.
Two seasonal closures. Seasonal closure for 2 months or no closure.
Two spatial closures. Spatial closure of 10 nautical miles around island or no closure.
Three minimum size limits. 35, 38, and 40 cm TL.
Levels of adjustement to the catch limit to account for uncertainty
Three levels of area closure. Reef perimeter closed to fishing. 16%, 32%, 50% closed.
Three levels of annual fishing effort. 0.5, 1, and 1.5 times 1996 effort.
Harvest Control Rule sets target F, fishery mortality level.  HCR implementation method not specified.
Potential Biological Removal levels set as limit reference points, e.g. catch levels
Two harvest control rules were evaluated in three uncertainty scenarios each.
Harvest Control Rule with TAC adjusted based on stock assessment output, specified by zone or region (zone area > region area)
Spatial Closures, of three types.  Marine protected areas, species risk based closures, and triggered closures based on effort
four Landing regulations:  landing obligation, 5% discard limit, year-to-year quota transfer, both
None, the current method is used in all simulations
Status quo, 2x, Profit max, Broken stick control rule, Spatial broken stick control rule
Spatial closures.  Closure trigger by zone or species with 20% or 30% triggers
8 approaches to setting P* buffer relative to F(lim).
5 harvest quotas options
Seasonal and area closures exist, but were constant across alternatives
Catch limits set by HCR derived from monitoring methodology alternatives
10% reduction annually until recovery achieved or no change
10% reduction annually until recovery achieved or no change
Area closures, open or closed evaulated
Limits set by a set of 4 Stock Assessment methodologies.
Lamprey trapping options: Traps located in 14 or 16 streams, baited or unbaited.
Lamprey baiting options: Used fixed bait amount or achieve a target in-water concentration.
Not evaluated by analysis, single alternative is a sex, size, and season regulation system
Two TACC decision rule alternatives.
3 F based control rules.  Constant F, Reduced F when SSB<0.4B(0), Reduced F when SSB<0.7B(0),
Constant across alternatives
4 temporal closure alternatives.  Base case, add May closure, add October closure, closure rule - if sample below threshold catch close
Two HCRs, based on a static or a dynamic B(0) used as a BRP.
Two HCRs, one with a constant F, and one with a variable F based on BRPs
Two additional HCRs, which correspond to the first two, but are adjusted based on environmental conditions.
4 management procedures covering different approaches to developing a rebuilding plan based on the acceptable recovery probability or inclusion of climate effects in the plan.
This is a TAC based fishery.  The TACs weren't the focus, but would be altered by reference point changes.
Two reference point options, one that shifts to account for climate change, and one that does not.
TAC implemented or not
Size limit implemented or not
marine protected areas implemented or not
Pollution reduction implemented or not
Note, not applicable to fishery management.  There are three approaches to beach replenishment, fixed amount and interval, fixed amount, and fixed interval, as well as no action.
Not cleared provided.
Spatial closures: No closures, 3 closure durations, 2 closure location rules
Size based closure rules: 4 options
Spatial closures: No closures, 3 closure durations, 2 closure location rules
Size based closure rules: 4 options
6 alternative methods for adjusting the catch limit.
Quota system, accompanied by location and gear restrictions, combined into 4 strategy
# of size limits utilized and areas to which they are applied
22 MPs available in the DLMtoolkit package in R, 11 output control MPs and 11 input control MPs
TAC=ABC set based on ICES F based proceedures (with and without uncertainty) and a constant F
4 HCRs.  2 based on BRPs and 2 proportional harvest rules, the difference in each category is whether there is an annual TAC change limit.
3 stock assessment methods.  XSA, Schaefer, Difference
2 levels, Status quo and reduction from 9000 to 5000 boat days
4 options, status quo, reef buffer area closure, Masig area closure, moon cycle calendar closure
No alternatives, a single Harvest quota accompanied by a season duration
4 TACs; 750 t, 1000 t, 1250 t, and 1500 t; competitave TAC vs ITQ
constant effort limit

four spatially explicit no-take extents: an extent consistent with that from the mid-1980s to mid-2004 (approximately 16% of coral trout habitat in the park); an extent implemented during rezoning in 2004 (32%); a hypothetical extent of 50% (Little et al. 2009a); and a hypothetical extent of 0%.

6 HCRs combining timeline and precaution:  a reactive decision interval with no additional ACL reduction, and five HCRs consisting of a fixed decision interval with precautionary ACL reductions of 0 (i.e., no reduction), 10, 20, 30, and 40%.
